sub_topic: Probability of a certain type of environmental event occurring in a region
message_1: A certain city has a 20% chance of experiencing heavy rain in a given day. On a certain day in the city, what is the probability that it will not rain heavily?
message_2:
The probability of an event not occurring is equal to 1 minus the probability of the event occurring. In this case, the probability of heavy rain is 20%, or 0.20 as a decimal. 

So, the probability of it not raining heavily is:

1 - 0.20 = 0.80

Therefore, there is an 80% chance that it will not rain heavily on a given day in the city.
